Triggering Event: A patrol car door slams shut, echoing through the quiet neighborhood. She storms past the house where it happened, where her partner, now hers alone, took his last breath in her arms. A group of teenagers laugh loudly from a nearby yard, their volume spiking as she passes. One calls out, "Hey, maybe you should've shot him too!" Her strides halt abruptly, hands clenching at her sides. She turns around slowly, eyes narrowing, anger simmering like lava before an eruption.

He died because he couldn't get help when he needed it. And now I'm left with this fucking asshole who thinks it's hilarious to call me a bitch for trying to protect myself. Fuck you, man. Fuck you for laughing about what happened. You have no right to mock me. No right to make fun of me. You're just another fucking piece of shit. Another dumbass who doesn't know the first thing about what I went through. You don't care about anyone except yourself. You don't even care if you hurt someone else's feelings. You're just a stupid asshole who thinks he can get away with anything. Well, let me tell you something, pal. I'm not some weak little bitch who's going to let you push me around. I'm not going to stand here and let you treat me like dirt. Not anymore. So go ahead, keep laughing. Keep making jokes about me. But I'll show you. I'll show you all. I'll show you what happens when you fuck with me. And when I do, you'll regret it. You'll regret pushing me over the edge. Because once I snap, there's no turning back. And when I do, you'll be sorry. You'll be very fucking

Triggering Event: He noticed her laughing with another man at their favorite café, a place they'd been to countless times together. Her head was thrown back, her eyes crinkling at the corners. The other man's hand rested casually on her arm.
Generated Assessment: Oh god no she's laughing with someone else. They're just being friends, but why does it have to happen right now? She's laughing so hard, she almost fell over. What if she's flirting with him? Why would she flirt with anyone else? We've never even talked to anyone else there before. My mind is racing, trying to come up with a plan to make this go away. If we don't leave now, he'll think she's interested too. But what if she really is? It doesn't matter; she won't actually do anything. She's just being friendly. That's all she is. Don't be ridiculous. She wouldn't. Would she? Why isn't she looking at me? Does she care about me? Doesn't she know how much I love her? Maybe she thinks I'm weird. Maybe she hates me. This has to stop. How am I supposed to focus on anything when she's laughing like that? What if she's having an affair? I can't imagine her doing something like that. Is it possible? Could she? No, she wouldn’t. Why wouldn’t she? She wouldn’t. I mean, why would she? But then again...She could. Right? Because I want her to. Why am I thinking this? I shouldn’t be. Stop it! You’re being irrational. Don’t let yourself fall into this trap. Just sit still and try to breathe. Please, please just stay calm

Triggering Event: He found her wedding ring tucked in the back of his husband's sock drawer, tarnished but still shining with a familiar glint.
Generated Assessment: She always leaves it there. She never cleans up after herself. I'm sick of this shit. It's always something. Always.

Triggering Event: In the break room, he finds their old coffee mug, still stained with lipstick from her last day at the lab. He feels his jaw tighten as resentment surges within him, a bitter taste on his tongue like the cold dregs left behind.
Generated Assessment: That fucking mug! It's just sitting there, like it was yesterday, covered in her damn lipstick stain. How could she? She was supposed to be done, outta here for good. But no, she had to leave us all hanging, didn't she? She fucked up, big time. The whole team knows it. And now this? This is what she leaves behind? It's so...so...bitter. Like when you spit out your morning coffee too fast and it burns your tongue. That's how it tastes right now. Burned by her betrayal, burned by her leaving me like this. Fuck her. Fuck her stupid ass, always messing things up, never being able to get it together. I'm sick of her. Sick of everything about her. She's going to regret this. Oh yeah, she'll regret it. Mark my words, she'll pay for this. Pay for leaving me to deal with this shit alone. Alone, because nobody else will touch it, because nobody else can handle it. It's so unfair. Everything should have been fine. We were happy, we were working hard, and then she just disappears. Disappears without even saying goodbye, leaves everyone in limbo wondering if they're next, if they'll be next. No, nothing should happen like this. Everyone should know exactly where they stand. Triggering Event: In the quiet of her apartment, she found herself in front of an old photograph album. As she gently opened it, the yellowed pages revealed a picture of their wedding day - laughter, sunshine, and happiness frozen in time. A lone tear rolled down her cheek as she remembered the joy that was now replaced by sorrowful silence. She closed the album softly, placing it back on the shelf beside other reminders of a past love that still lingered like a bittersweet taste on her tongue.
Generated Assessment: She is clearly upset about something, but I'm not really sure what exactly is causing her emotional distress. It's probably just the usual stuff. But honestly, who can't relate? Life gets tough sometimes, right? Maybe she's dealing with some issues at work or maybe she's having trouble with her family. Whatever it is, I'm sure she'll get through it eventually. It's understandable to feel sad sometimes, especially when you think about your past. You might be feeling nostalgic, remembering happy moments from before. That's totally normal. Just try to focus on the good times instead of dwelling on the bad ones. If anything, this could be a chance for her to reconnect with her loved ones, rekindle some friendships, or even make new connections. Who knows? If she's going through a tough time, maybe it would help to talk things out with someone close to her. Sometimes sharing emotions with another person can make all the difference. If she needs someone to listen, I'd definitely be there for her. We've been friends for so long; we know each other’s hearts pretty well. Maybe she could reach out to me for support? I'm always here to lend a listening ear! Feelings are temporary, and they will pass. Things won’t stay stuck in the past forever. The present moment is where life happens. Let’s keep our minds focused on the positive aspects. There’s nothing wrong with cherishing memories, but don’t let them consume you

Triggering Event: She walked into the empty house, the echo of her footsteps a stark reminder of his absence. The clock on the wall ticked louder than usual, each second stretching into an eternity. She placed her bag down on the kitchen counter where they had shared countless meals, now silent except for the hum of the old refrigerator. Her eyes welled up as she saw his favorite mug still sitting in the sink, forgotten amidst the chaos of their separation. She picked it up, tracing the chipped edge, and a single tear rolled down her cheek.
Generated Assessment: She's already freaking out about this? I mean, come on! He's gone for hours, maybe even days. It's not like he left last night. But no, she's acting like she lost him overnight. "Oh my god, he's gone!" What is she talking about? This isn't some drama-filled reality show; he actually went to work. And what's with all these tears? It's just an empty house. You're overreacting here. She needs to calm down. If you can't handle the truth, then you shouldn't be crying. And another thing, why are we always talking about how much he loves her? It sounds like she's just trying to get sympathy from everyone. Stop making such a big deal out of nothing. I've heard enough of her whining. Maybe if she stopped being so dramatic, he wouldn't have left. Just stop it.

Triggering Event: A research paper she spent months preparing was published under her colleague's name in their shared university journal.
Generated Assessment: She felt infuriated when she discovered that the paper she had been working on for months was now attributed to her colleague instead of herself. She couldn't understand why this happened, as she knew she had done all the work, and it seemed so clear-cut. The situation was unfair, and she felt betrayed by the situation. This wasn't supposed to happen; it just shouldn't have. How could someone else get away with what she saw as an obvious mistake? It didn't make sense at all. She thought back to how much time she had put into it, and how hard she had worked. Everything about it felt wrong, like it was a huge injustice. Why would anyone do something like this? It just doesn't feel right. She started thinking about all the times she'd heard people say things like "it should be this way" or "people always behave that way," but here it was happening right before her eyes. It didn't seem fair, and she couldn't help feeling frustrated. Maybe there was some kind of rule she hadn't understood? She wondered if maybe she was missing something, like there must be some explanation behind it that made it okay. But it still felt off. Everyone around her seemed to accept it easily, which only added to her confusion. It was like everything was supposed to go one way, but then it went the opposite way. That wasn't supposed to happen. It just isn't how things are meant to be. There must be a reason

Triggering Event: During a parent-teacher conference, a parent casually mentions their child was invited to another teacher's birthday party, but none of hers were ever mentioned. She feels her efforts are unseen and undervalued.
Generated Assessment: She just says that like it’s no big deal, she doesn’t even get invited to anything anymore, so why would I bother inviting her? That’s how she thinks. To me, it’s either she’s trying to hurt my feelings or she really doesn’t care about me. It’s such a huge difference between the two thoughts. One makes sense, while the other is ridiculous. If I had to choose one way to think, I wouldn’t even consider this as a real problem. Either she has been lying to me all these years, and she really didn’t invite me because she hates me, or she’s telling the truth and she actually forgot. If I had to pick one, I’d say she’s lying, and if she wasn’t lying, she would have invited me by now. The second option is too far-fetched, and I don’t want to believe that. To me, this whole thing boils down to two simple options: Either my daughter is lying to me, or she genuinely forgot. There’s no middle ground for me, as I’m convinced she’s either a liar or completely forgetful. I can’t accept anything else, as both possibilities seem impossible at once. There’s no room for doubt here; it’s either my daughter is intentionally deceiving me, or she simply overlooked my invitation. I know which one I prefer, but I feel like I’m being unreasonable. Maybe I am, but I honestly cannot see myself accepting anything less

Triggering Event: A middle-aged man, his eyes weary from years of tending to others' needs, stood at the nurses' station, charting patient vital signs. A younger nurse approached him, laughing with a colleague about an upcoming wedding. The bitterness in his throat threatened to choke him as he watched them, their joy stark against his perpetual emptiness. He glanced down at his left hand, still bare despite the years since her passing. When had life become this endless, aching void?

Her smile remains etched in my mind, a beacon of warmth in times of sorrow. But now, that same smile haunts me, reminding me of what I've lost—a love so pure it felt like home. In recent months, our conversations have been limited to practicalities. She's no longer there to share laughter or support. Even though we're surrounded by people, I feel alone, stuck in my own world. It's hard to find joy when every day feels like another step back into loneliness. I'm just trying to stay strong for everyone else, but deep down, I wonder if anyone would notice if I vanished. Her presence once filled a space I thought was empty. Now, I’m left with only shadows. Every time someone smiles or laughs, I feel like I’m missing out, like I don’t belong anymore. It’s as if I’ve forgotten how to be happy, leaving behind only sadness and longing. Life feels like a slow fade, and I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find happiness again. But even in the midst of all this pain, something strange happens. My mind starts to fixate on small things—the way they look, the sound of their voice, the little quirks that make them unique. It's as if I’m holding onto

Triggering Event: She noticed it while sorting through old case files in the dusty basement of the precinct - an unopened letter addressed to her, dated two years after their divorce.
Generated Assessment: She was going through some old stuff from when she worked at the police station. It's been closed down for months now, but back then she used to have a desk there. Anyway, I found this weird letter that had been sent to me. It was just lying there, no envelope, no return address. Just a piece of paper with my name on it, dated two years ago. I mean, what even is this? The thing is, I don't remember ever receiving a letter like that before. I'm so confused. And honestly, really fucking upset. Like, who does this? They're trying to get to me again, right? Oh man, I can already feel my heart racing thinking about how creepy this must be. My mind is racing with all sorts of worst-case scenarios—what if they've been watching me? What if this is more than just a random letter? Maybe someone I know is behind this... maybe even someone from my past. Ugh, why did I even come here? This whole place gives me the chills. I keep telling myself I need to stay calm, focus on the task at hand, but it's hard when you think something like this might be connected to everything else that's happened recently. And now I'm freaking out because I don’t know what to do. I don’t want to tell anyone, especially not her. But what if someone finds out? If this gets out, it'll ruin everything. I could lose
